title: Champs that are Broken but not OP
body:
I DO NOT THINK THESE CHAMPS ARE OP.

First let's define Broken and OP.
Broken: Generally lacking counterplay and is unfun to play against. EG. {{champion:78}} 
OP: Outclasses most of it's opponents due to sheer stats alone. EG. {{champion:222}}

Now to the list:
{{champion:429}}: Boing, Boing, Boing.
{{champion:78}}: Fuck that ult, just... FUCK IT.
{{champion:75}}: I Q, You QQ.
{{champion:7}}: The implacable woman.
{{champion:74}}: Erectin' a Sentry. And Another. And another. 
{{champion:30}} That ult will make you cry at night untill you can get a zhonyas. And god help you if you're not AP.
{{champion:114}} and {{champion:105}} Untargetability and mobility.

Anyone else you think are broken BUT NOT OP.

His ultimate is best placed on an ADC who has on-hit effects.

I said they were strong then, I'm saying they're strong now.

You know why they're FoTM?

Because they're strong and people learned about them.

Here, maybe this can help clear some things up?
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3704154

The entire concept of a broken champion is one that cannot be fixed with their current kit intact.  The premier example of this is Poppy, but others exist.

I'm not saying you don't know how this game works (because you do), I'm saying you don't know the definition of broken.

Since when did G&B decide that *that* is the definition of broken?

They mean the same thing, guys. Every character can be fixed with their current kit intact (if you're including small additions/subtractions of pieces to the kit as keeping the kit intact). You just need to do it correctly.

Poppy's ultimate needs to be changed so she deals less bonus damage to her target and she's invulnerable for less time than she currently is. To make up for this, buff her W's bonus armour and AD gain a tad so CSing with her is easier. From there, reduce the damage reduction her passive offers as well.

OP literally stated what definition of "Broken" he was using for this thread's purposes, if you're using a different one your post belongs somewhere else. Also it's a pretty common distinction in the community anyhow.

(Also Poppy's Ult will always either be intensely frustrating to go against or just flat out useless.)

Right, and those champions are both broken (unfun to play against) and OP, outclassing almost everyone else in their specific roles. The two go hand-in-hand as almost the same definition.

No, Poppy's ult can be tuned properly to be good for her to use and not be completely broken, you just need to do it correctly.

This needs to be changed
http://puu.sh/hrGze/ea78d8770c.png

To 5/6/7 seconds and 
15/25/35% increases
respectively

In this case, "Broken" means that the thing that makes them unfun to play is a fundamental part of their kit that can't just be nerfed away. Hecarim and Sejuani are only unfun to play against because they're strong right now, nobody had a problem with them back when they were both just subpar junglers.

I hate playing against Irelia, but is she really OP? I could see her being broken since her kit is a bit overloaded, but I generally end up in a bad matchup against her so I can't tell if she's overpowered or if I'm just getting screwed.

Zed gets a lot of QQ and I think he needs some specific nerfs, but I don't think he's broken. Compared to a lot of champs he has more counterplay in his kit than most and I think that with some slight tweaks he could be fine. (Less safe laning phase -> Less fed Zed mid/late game -> Less dueling potential and insta-deletion)

(Less safe laning phase -> Less fed Zed mid/late game -> Less dueling potential and insta-deletion)

Zed needs an early-level Q nerf and the bonus AD removed from his W. Potentially also a tether range to be re-added to his ultimate.

I think his Passive should not work on minions, and his Q should be changed so he can't use it to farm as well (the damage to champions early game is fine).  

The point of his bonus ad is to make his AA more powerful, since they can change the scaling on his abilities to match the bonus AD. I actually think they should increase the bonus AD and decrease his scaling more, so that he has incentive to stay and AA his assassination target instead of just dumping his abilities on them. 

HIs ult wouldn't need a tether if he had to stay longer to charge it up. I find my biggest peeve with it is that even though it is highly telegraphed you can't stop his damage because using animation cancelling he can dump all of his abilities on you in a fraction of a second. As a support this is annoying because even though I know where he's going to be he can actually use all of his abilities before a single one of my targeted abilities hit him. If instead he had to stay to auto attack his target more than once he'd be easier to hit.
